WaveSoundBuffer.filters

Function/Meaning
Filter Array
Type
Property of the WaveSoundBuffer class (Read-only)
Description
An array (instance of the Array class) that holds insertion filter objects.
By registering filter objects in this array, various effects can be applied to the audio in real-time during playback.
Changes to the filter array are only reflected when the WaveSoundBuffer.open method is executed. Until then, any changes made to this array will not take effect.
Example:
var buf = new WaveSoundBuffer(window);
(omitted)
buf.filters.clear(); // Clear the filter array
buf.filters.add(new WaveSoundBuffer.PhaseVocoder()); // Add PhaseVocoder filter
buf.filters[0].time = 0.5; // Double-speed playback
